c74object.name: zsa.freqpeak~
c74object.digest: Extract a list of pairs Frequency / Amplitude peaks by FFT frame.
c74object.description:
zsa.freqpeak~
is based on the widely known method defined by Serra and Smith III (see X. Serra, J. O. Smith III "Spectral modeling synthesis: A sound analysis/synthesis system based on a deterministic plus stochastic decomposition", Computer Music Journal (1990) vol. 14 (4) pp. 12-24) where a peak is defined as a local maximum in the real magnitude spectrum. The object works in the spectral domain, so you need to use it whithin
pfft~
.

method.description: Double-clicking on the object causes the Zsa Descriptors splash screen to appear. You'll find the version number and date there.

method.name: signal
method.description:
If both signal inlets are connected, left signal inlet expects real values and right inlet expects imaginary values. If the left inlet is the only signal connected input, the signal is interpreted as the energy (you need to calculate it using
cartopol~
or better
zsa.energy~
).

attribute.name: autolength
attribute.description:
When
autolength
attribute is set, the size of the list sent out the outlet depends on the number of peaks found in each analysis window, if
autolength
is set to 0, the list is filled by zeroes to complete the number of items (defined by the
peaks
attribute).

attribute.name: peaks
attribute.description:
Specifies the number of loudest peaks returned by
zsa.freqpeaks~
.

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.description:
Noise threshold in linear scale (the default value is 0.01). It helps
zsa.freqpeak~
to eliminate frequencies which have a very low amplitude.
